SEARCH
Package classifiers

Class ClassifierUtilities

java.lang.Object
classifiers.ClassifierUtilities
public final class ClassifierUtilities extends Object
Utility class for working with KMeansClassifier and KNNClassifier. Generally used for common operations related to data splitting, hyperparameter tuning, confusion matrix printing, and KMeans model evaluation.
Author:
[Latif Yaya, Kentaro Sauce]

  • Method Details

    • calculateMinkowskiDistance

      public static float calculateMinkowskiDistance(List<Float> coordinates1, List<Float> coordinates2, int p)
      Calculates the Minkowski distance (Lp norm) between two coordinates. The Minkowski metric is a general class of metrics for d-dimensional coordinates. It includes the Euclidean distance (p=2) and the Manhattan distance (p=1).
      Parameters:
      coordinates1 - The list of the first coordinates to calculate the distance from.
      coordinates2 - The list of the second coordinates to calculate the distance to.
      p - The order of the Minkowski norm, influencing the calculation.
      Returns:
      The Minkowski distance between the two coordinates.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If p is less than 1.
      IllegalArgumentException - If the dimensions of the coordinates are not equal.

    • splitData

      public static List<Sample>[] splitData(List<Sample> dataSet, float trainSetRatio)
      Splits a dataset into shuffled training and test sets based on the given ratio.
      Parameters:
      dataSet - The dataset to be split.
      trainSetRatio - The ratio of the dataset to be allocated to the training set.
      Returns:
      An array containing two lists: the training set and the test set.

    • getHyperparameters

      public static Map<String,Double> getHyperparameters(List<Sample> trainingSet)
      Finds the best hyperparameters for a KNN classifier using the given training set.
      Parameters:
      trainingSet - The data set of samples used for hyperparameter tuning.
      Returns:
      A map containing the best hyperparameters and their corresponding accuracy.

    • printConfusionMatrix

      public static void printConfusionMatrix(int[][] confusionMatrix)
      Prints the confusion matrix for either a KNN or a KMeans classification.
      Parameters:
      confusionMatrix - The confusion matrix to be printed.

    • computeBestKmeansModel

      public static KMeansClassifier computeBestKmeansModel(int maxEvaluationIterations, int k, List<Sample> dataSet, boolean usingPP, int maxIterations, int distanceNorm, int randomSeed)
      Computes the best KMeansClassifier model of given parameters based on multiple evaluations. All RNG is decided by the given seed.
      Parameters:
      maxEvaluationIterations - The maximum number of evaluations to perform before deciding the best model.
      k - Number of clusters to form.
      dataSet - List of samples representing the dataset.
      usingPP - Whether to initialize centroids using the k-means++ strategy or naively.
      maxIterations - Maximum number of iterations for the KMeans algorithm.
      distanceNorm - Order of the Minkowski norm for distance calculation.
      randomSeed - Seed for all RNG in the algorithm.
      Returns:
      The best KMeansClassifier model based on its macro F1 score.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If maxEvaluationIterations is not in the range [0, 100].

    • computeBestKmeansModel

      public static KMeansClassifier computeBestKmeansModel(int maxEvaluationIterations, int k, List<Sample> dataSet, boolean usingPP, int maxIterations, int distanceNorm)
      Computes the best KMeansClassifier model of given parameters based on multiple evaluations.
      Parameters:
      maxEvaluationIterations - The maximum number of evaluations to perform before deciding the best model.
      k - Number of clusters to form.
      dataSet - List of samples representing the dataset.
      usingPP - Whether to initialize centroids using the k-means++ strategy or naively.
      maxIterations - Maximum number of iterations for the KMeans algorithm.
      distanceNorm - Order of the Minkowski norm for distance calculation.
      Returns:
      The best KMeansClassifier model based on its macro F1 score.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If maxEvaluationIterations is not in the range [0, 100].
